categories.name: General Management Practices
categories.description: Practices adapted from general business management for service management

practices.name: Architecture Management
practices.description: Provide an understanding of all the different elements that make up an organization and how those elements interrelate.

practices.name: Continual Improvement
practices.description: Align the organization's practices and services with changing business needs through the ongoing identification and improvement of services.

practices.name: Information Security Management
practices.description: Protect the information needed by the organization to conduct its business.

practices.name: Knowledge Management
practices.description: Maintain and improve the effective, efficient, and convenient use of information and knowledge across the organization.

practices.name: Measurement and Reporting
practices.description: Support good decision-making and continual improvement by decreasing the levels of uncertainty.

practices.name: Organizational Change Management
practices.description: Ensure that changes in an organization are smoothly and successfully implemented and that lasting benefits are achieved.

practices.name: Portfolio Management
practices.description: Ensure that the organization has the right mix of programs, projects, products, and services to execute its strategy.

practices.name: Project Management
practices.description: Ensure that all projects in the organization are successfully delivered.

practices.name: Relationship Management
practices.description: Establish and nurture the links between the organization and its stakeholders.

practices.name: Risk Management
practices.description: Ensure that the organization understands and effectively handles risks.

practices.name: Service Financial Management
practices.description: Support the organization's strategies and plans for service management by ensuring financial resources and investments are being used effectively.

practices.name: Strategy Management
practices.description: Formulate the goals of the organization and adopt the courses of action and allocation of resources necessary for achieving those goals.

practices.name: Supplier Management
practices.description: Ensure that the organization's suppliers and their performances are managed appropriately.

practices.name: Workforce and Talent Management
practices.description: Ensure that the organization has the right people with the appropriate skills and knowledge.

categories.name: Service Management Practices
categories.description: Practices developed in service management and ITSM industries

practices.name: Availability Management
practices.description: Ensure that services deliver agreed levels of availability to meet the needs of customers and users.

practices.name: Business Analysis
practices.description: Analyze a business or some element of a business, define its needs, and recommend solutions to address those needs.

practices.name: Capacity and Performance Management
practices.description: Ensure that services achieve agreed and expected performance, satisfying current and future demand in a cost-effective way.

practices.name: Change Enablement
practices.description: Maximize the number of successful IT changes by ensuring that risks have been properly assessed.

practices.name: Incident Management
practices.description: Minimize the negative impact of incidents by restoring normal service operation as quickly as possible.

practices.name: IT Asset Management
practices.description: Plan and manage the full lifecycle of all IT assets to help the organization maximize value.

practices.name: Monitoring and Event Management
practices.description: Systematically observe services and service components and record and report selected changes of state.

practices.name: Problem Management
practices.description: Reduce the likelihood and impact of incidents by identifying actual and potential causes of incidents and managing workarounds.

practices.name: Release Management
practices.description: Make new and changed services and features available for use.

practices.name: Service Catalog Management
practices.description: Provide a single source of consistent information on all services and service offerings.

practices.name: Service Configuration Management
practices.description: Ensure that accurate and reliable information about the configuration of services is available when and where it is needed.

practices.name: Service Continuity Management
practices.description: Ensure that the availability and performance of a service are maintained at sufficient levels in case of a disaster.

practices.name: Service Design
practices.description: Design products and services that are fit for purpose, fit for use, and can be delivered by the organization.

practices.name: Service Desk
practices.description: Capture demand for incident resolution and service requests. It should also be the entry point and single point of contact for the service provider.

practices.name: Service Level Management
practices.description: Set clear business-based targets for service levels and ensure that delivery of services is properly assessed, monitored, and managed.

practices.name: Service Request Management
practices.description: Support the agreed quality of a service by handling all predefined, user-initiated service requests in an effective and user-friendly manner.

practices.name: Service Validation and Testing
practices.description: Ensure that new or changed products and services meet defined requirements.

categories.name: Technical Management Practices
categories.description: Practices adapted from technology management domains

practices.name: Deployment Management
practices.description: Move new or changed hardware, software, documentation, processes, or any other component to live environments.

practices.name: Infrastructure and Platform Management
practices.description: Oversee the infrastructure and platforms used by an organization to deliver services.

practices.name: Software Development and Management
practices.description: Ensure that applications meet internal and external stakeholder needs in terms of functionality, reliability, maintainability, compliance, and auditability.
